title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 February 2015 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:48 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <gsmeria> has quit  
09:52 <gsmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <DarkKnightCZ1> has quit  
10:02 <gsmeria1> has quit  
10:03 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <cjd> has quit  
10:15 <vmassol> hi guys  
10:16 <vmassol> we need to release 6.4.2 ASAP  
10:16 <vmassol> I see that we still have this blocker: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11750  
10:16 <lucaa> has quit  
10:17 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: is that an issue you could look at?  
10:17 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <gdelhumeau> I'm not sure  
10:17 <gdelhumeau> it seems the good fix is to create a virtual group  
10:18 <vmassol> that seems a workaround, not a fix but I haven't followed  
10:18 <vmassol> ATM the XWikiAllGroup virtual group is optional  
10:22 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <vmassol> so this week we need to release 6.4.2 and 6.2.6 asap  
10:30 <vmassol> Marius, can you prepare for the 6.4.2 release asap? I'll take the 6.2.6 one  
10:31 <vmassol> (according to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ReleaseManagerRoster it's our turn)  
10:32 <vmassol> and 7.0M2 is next Monday  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: what if I handle 6.4.2?  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> because I'm supposed to release 7.0M2 but I'll actually be busy at this time  
10:40 <vmassol> ok then, mflorea could take 6.2.6 and I'll take 7.0M2  
10:40 <vmassol> (if mflorea agrees)  
10:41 <mflorea> I prefer 7.0M2  
10:41 <vmassol> ok, I can take 6.2.6 and you take 7.0M2  
10:41 <vmassol> updating page  
10:41 <mflorea> perfect for me, hope it's not an issue for you vmassol  
10:42 <vmassol> no it's fine  
10:42 <mflorea> ok, great  
10:56 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:10 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
11:15 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
12:10 <lucaa> has quit  
12:16 <cjd> has quit  
12:29 <lucaa1> has quit  
12:31 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <lucaa> has quit  
12:45 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: could I leave it to you to validate https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/387 ?  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> ok  
13:07 <vmassol> thanks  
13:08 <vmassol> after lunch, I'll try to get ci.xwiki.org working to see how is the 6.2.x branch and I'll start the 6.2.6 release when the build passes  
13:23 <vmassol> hmm strange there's no 6.2.6 artifacts for http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-mail-ui/  
13:24 <vmassol> normally the nexus cleanup should keep at least 1 snapshot artifact AFAIK  
13:24 <vmassol> checking  
13:26 <vmassol> yep just checked and we keep 1  
13:26 <vmassol> maybe someone deleted it manually  
13:54 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <Slashman> has quit  
14:15 <gsmeria> has quit  
14:15 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:19 <DarkKnightCZ1> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:23 <Slashman\_> has quit  
14:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> Enygma`: you broke the platform build  
14:43 <vmassol> trying to understand why...  
14:51 <lucaa> has quit  
14:52 <DarkKnightCZ1> has left #xwiki  
15:03 <vmassol> Enygma`: ok found it, mail-ui doesn't exist in 6.2.x :)  
15:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <lucaa> has quit  
15:51 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:56 <gsmeria> has quit  
16:00 <lucaa> has quit  
16:03 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:16 <vrachieru> has quit  
17:26 <vmassol> tmortagne: just built XE from sources and I got a problem with EM  
17:26 <vmassol> (when trying to install the FAQ app)  
17:26 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/ee131ede1202188dd04d/raw/1f8de92cdaef4363f83b747207354f4e7b2e061a/gistfile1.txt  
17:26 <vmassol> looks like some important piece missing  
17:27 <vmassol> scratch that  
17:27 <vmassol> oh wait  
17:27 <vmassol> I probably used the worng aid  
17:27 <vmassol> \*id  
17:27 <vmassol> checking  
17:27 <vmassol> argh  
17:27 <vmassol> my bad  
17:27 <vmassol> sorry for the noise  
17:59 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: might be good to explain how the sort is done for int getOrder() in WikiCreationStep. Lower value has higher priorities?  
18:00 <vmassol> (I'm talking about the javadoc)  
18:00 <vmassol> for example for Macro.java, we have:  
18:00 <vmassol> \* The priority of execution relative to the other Macros. The lowest values have the highest priorities and execute  
18:00 <vmassol> \* first. For example a Macro with a priority of 100 will execute before one with a priority of 500.  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> ok, I'll do that  
18:01 <vmassol> it's nice to be able to add steps now :)  
18:02 <cjd> has quit  
18:04 <gdelhumeau> :)  
18:05 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:08 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:33 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:54 <lucaa> has quit
